member.returns: YES if the receiver implements or inherits a method that can respond to aSelector, otherwise NO.

member.name: M:Monobjc.Growl.GrowlApplicationBridge.NotifyWithTitleDescriptionNotificationNameIconDataPriorityIsStickyClickContext(Monobjc.Cocoa.NSString,Monobjc.Cocoa.NSString,Monobjc.Cocoa.NSString,Monobjc.Cocoa.NSData,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Monobjc.Id)

summary.para: Send a Growl notification.

Original signature is '+ (void) notifyWithTitle:(NSString *)title description:(NSString *)description notificationName:(NSString *)notifName iconData:(NSData *)iconData priority:(signed int)priority isSticky:(BOOL)isSticky clickContext:(id)clickContext;'
Available in Growl v1.2 and later.

member.param: The title of the notification displayed to the user.
The full description of the notification displayed to the user.
The internal name of the notification. Should be human-readable, as it will be displayed in the Growl preference pane.
object to show with the notification as its icon. If nil, the application's icon will be used instead.
The priority of the notification. The default value is 0; positive values are higher priority and negative values are lower priority. Not all Growl displays support priority.
If YES, the notification will remain on screen until clicked. Not all Growl displays support sticky notifications.

A context passed back to the Growl delegate if it implements -(void)growlNotificationWasClicked: and the notification is clicked. Not all display plugins support clicking. The clickContext must be plist-encodable (completely of , , , , and types).

member.name: M:Monobjc.Growl.GrowlApplicationBridge.NotifyWithTitleDescriptionNotificationNameIconDataPriorityIsStickyClickContextIdentifier(Monobjc.Cocoa.NSString,Monobjc.Cocoa.NSString,Monobjc.Cocoa.NSString,Monobjc.Cocoa.NSData,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Monobjc.Id,Monobjc.Cocoa.NSString)

summary.para: Send a Growl notification.

Original signature is '+ (void) notifyWithTitle:(NSString *)title description:(NSString *)description notificationName:(NSString *)notifName iconData:(NSData *)iconData priority:(signed int)priority isSticky:(BOOL)isSticky clickContext:(id)clickContext identifier:(NSString *)identifier;'
Available in Growl v1.2 and later.

member.param: The title of the notification displayed to the user.
The full description of the notification displayed to the user.
The internal name of the notification. Should be human-readable, as it will be displayed in the Growl preference pane.
object to show with the notification as its icon. If nil, the application's icon will be used instead.
The priority of the notification. The default value is 0; positive values are higher priority and negative values are lower priority. Not all Growl displays support priority.
If YES, the notification will remain on screen until clicked. Not all Growl displays support sticky notifications.

A context passed back to the Growl delegate if it implements -(void)growlNotificationWasClicked: and the notification is clicked. Not all display plugins support clicking. The clickContext must be plist-encodable (completely of , , , , and types).
An identifier for this notification. Notifications with equal identifiers are coalesced.

member.name: M:Monobjc.Growl.GrowlApplicationBridge.RegisterWithDictionary(Monobjc.Cocoa.NSDictionary)

Original signature is '+ (BOOL) registerWithDictionary:(NSDictionary *)c;'
Available in Growl v1.2 and later.

member.param: The dictionary.

member.name: M:Monobjc.Growl.GrowlApplicationBridge.RegistrationDictionaryByFillingInDictionary(Monobjc.Cocoa.NSDictionary)

summary.para: Tries to fill in missing keys in a registration dictionary.
Original signature is '+ (NSDictionary *) registrationDictionaryByFillingInDictionary:(NSDictionary *)regDict;'
Available in Growl v1.2 and later.

member.param: The dictionary to fill in.
member.returns: The dictionary with the keys filled in. This is an autoreleased copy of regDict.

member.name: M:Monobjc.Growl.GrowlApplicationBridge.RegistrationDictionaryByFillingInDictionaryRestrictToKeys(Monobjc.Cocoa.NSDictionary,Monobjc.Cocoa.NSSet)

summary.para: Tries to fill in missing keys in a registration dictionary.
Original signature is '+ (NSDictionary *) registrationDictionaryByFillingInDictionary:(NSDictionary *)regDict;'
Available in Growl v1.2 and later.

member.param: The dictionary to fill in.
The keys to fill in. If nil, any missing keys are filled in.
member.returns: The dictionary with the keys filled in. This is an autoreleased copy of regDict.
